item.title: Switch 2》销售火爆，任天堂涨幅扩大至创纪录水平
item.description: 任天堂公司股价创下两个月来最大涨幅，创下新纪录，原因是投资者更加关注该公司强劲的销售增长，认为它可以抵御全球波动。【原文：Nintendo Co. shares rallied the most in two months to a fresh record as investors increased their focus on the firm’s strong sales growth as a shelter from global volatility.】

item.title: 资金短缺，中国汽车以旧换新补贴在部分地区停止发放
item.description: 由于资金短缺以及官员对 "零里程 "二手车盛行的审查，中国至少有六个省的重点城市暂停了为促进电动汽车和节油汽车销售而提供的以旧换新补贴。【原文：China’s trade-in subsidy to boost sales of electric and fuel-efficient vehicles has been suspended in key cities across at least six provinces as funds run short and officials scrutinize the prevalence of ‘zero-mileage’ used cars.】

item.title: 创始人起诉儿子，韩国化妆品公司 Kolmar 股价暴涨 25
item.description: 韩国化妆品生产商科玛控股公司（Kolmar Holdings Co.【原文：Shares of South Korean cosmetics maker Kolmar Holdings Co. jumped as much as 25% after a subsidiary confirmed its founder sued to reclaim shares gifted to his eldest son.】

item.title: 道达尔称可利用不断增长的液化天然气供应替代俄罗斯天然气
item.description: 由于欧盟提议在 2027 年底前禁止从俄罗斯输送天然气，道达尔能源 SE 公司认为俄罗斯天然气有丰富的替代品。【原文：TotalEnergies SE sees abundant alternatives to Russian gas as the European Union proposes a ban on all deliveries from the country by the end of 2027.】

item.title: 印度小盘股将因盈利改善而跑赢大盘股
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 石油期权比俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后更看涨
item.description: 现在的石油期权比 2022 年俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后更看涨，这表明以色列和伊朗的交锋令全球市场岌岌可危，人们猜测美国可能会加入攻击行列。【原文：Oil options are now more bullish than after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022, showing a global market that’s on edge as Israel and Iran trade blows, and speculation mounts that the US may join the attack.】

item.title: Caris 生命科学公司首次公开募股价格高于区间，募集资金 4.94 亿美元
item.description: 利用技术帮助诊断和治疗癌症的医疗保健公司 Caris Life Sciences Inc.【原文：Caris Life Sciences Inc., a health-care company that uses technology to help diagnose and treat cancer, raised $494 million in a US initial public offering that priced above the top of its marketed range.】

item.title: 石破称日本将保护贸易利益而非急于达成协议
item.description: 日本首相石破茂在结束为期两天的七国集团会议时表示，日本将在贸易谈判中优先保护本国利益，而不会匆忙与美国达成协议。【原文：Japan will prioritize protecting its national interests in trade talks without rushing into a deal with the US, Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said as he wrapped up two days of meetings at the Group of Seven gathering.】

item.title: 新世界与路易威登香港新店达成协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港新世界发展有限公司已与路易威登达成协议，将在金融中心开设一家新的大型购物中心。【原文：Hong Kong’s New World Development Co. has secured an agreement with Louis Vuitton to open a new megastore in the financial hub, according to people familiar with the matter, as global luxury giants eye bigger, more unique spaces to lure wealthy shoppers.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理称欧洲贸易协定具有 "重要象征意义
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞（Anthony Albanese）周三表示，在保护主义抬头的环境下，扩大澳大利亚与欧盟之间的贸易关系将具有 "重要的象征意义"。【原文：Expanding trade ties between Australia and the European Union would be “symbolically important” in an environment of rising protectionism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Wednesday, as the two sides also plan talks on a defense agreement.】

item.title: 过时的人口普查数据威胁印度庞大的福利计划
item.description:
政府依靠旧数据制定预算和政策。【原文：

The government relies on old figures to shape budgets and policies.

】

item.title: 美国关税引发衰退风险，日本出口下降
item.description: 由于美国的关税行动给全球贸易带来压力，日本的出口八个月来首次出现下降，这增加了日本经济在年初收缩后出现技术性衰退的风险。【原文：Japan’s exports fell for the first time in eight months as the US tariff campaign weighed on global trade, raising the risk of a technical recession after the economy contracted at the start of the year.】

item.title: 中国焦煤市场在停产后获得喘息机会
item.description: 中国焦煤期货本月出现了罕见的回升，最近的涨势是由于监管机构在山西矿业中心进行环境评估时暂时停止了生产。【原文：Chinese coking coal futures have staged a rare recovery this month, with the latest gains driven by temporary halts to production in the mining hub of Shanxi as regulators conduct environmental assessments.】

item.title: 特朗普正在驱赶投资者并威胁美元统治
item.description:
总统的经济议程正在拖累美元，使美国更加难以为赤字融资。【原文：

The president’s economic agenda is dragging down the dollar and making it more difficult for the US to finance its deficits.

】

item.title: 奥特曼称 Meta 为 OpenAI 员工提供了 1 亿美元奖金
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）表示，Meta Platforms 公司为其员工提供了高达 1 亿美元的签约奖金，以及更丰厚的年度薪酬，以建立一支顶尖的人工智能团队。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said Meta Platforms Inc. has offered his employees signing bonuses as high as $100 million, with even larger annual compensation packages, as it seeks to build a top artificial intelligence team.】

item.title: 美联储再次按兵不动，官员们等待经济形势更加明朗
item.description: 人们普遍预计，美联储官员将在周三的会议上连续第四次维持利率不变，重申他们希望在调整借贷成本之前，能更清楚地了解政府一系列政策变化对经济的影响。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are widely expected to leave interest rates unchanged for a fourth straight meeting on Wednesday, reiterating they want more clarity on the economic impact of a wide array of government policy changes before adjusting borrowing costs.】

item.title: 日本石原慎太郎与韩国李明博在七国集团会议上举行首次会谈
item.description: 据日本政府称，日本首相石破茂与韩国总统李在明举行了首次面对面会谈，这很可能是两国未来关系走向的早期迹象。【原文：Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and South Korean President Lee Jae Myung held their first in-person talks, according to the Japanese government, in what was likely to be an early indication of the direction of future relations between the two countries.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Anysphere 以超过 180 亿美元的估值获得风险投资的青睐
item.description:
硅谷的投资者急于支持他们口中发展最快的初创公司。【原文：

Silicon Valley investors are anxious to back the startup they say is the fastest growing of all time.

】

item.title: 中东动荡加剧，石油涨势渐起：市场综述
item.description: 由于人们担心中东紧张局势升级可能引发美国更直接的介入，石油价格攀升，亚洲股市也将追随华尔街的暴跌。【原文：Oil climbed and stocks in Asia are set to follow a slump on Wall Street as concerns mount that an escalation of tensions in the Middle East could trigger a more direct US involvement.】

item.title: 中国如何打造一支强大的黑客军团.
item.description:
今天的 "Big Take Asia "播客将介绍中国国内的黑客竞赛如何帮助提高中国的网络间谍能力。【原文：

On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.

】

item.title: 特朗普引发中东局势升级担忧，石油涨势扩大
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普助长了美国即将加入以色列对伊朗的攻击的猜测，石油在周二跳升至近五个月来的最高点后上涨。【原文：Oil rose after jumping to the highest in almost five months on Tuesday, as President Donald Trump fueled speculation that the US is on the verge of joining Israel’s attack on Iran.】

item.title: 决策者关注通胀风险，智利维持关键利率不变
item.description: 智利中央银行连续第四次会议维持其关键利率不变，同时表示，如果中东冲突没有造成供应冲击，它将在未来几个月内恢复降息。【原文：Chile’s central bank kept its key interest rate unchanged for the fourth straight meeting, while indicating that it would resume cuts in the next few months, bar a supply shock from the Middle East conflict.】

item.title: 新西兰计划从 2030 年起改用数据驱动的年度人口普查
item.description: 新西兰将放弃五年一次的人口普查，从 2030 年起采用一种新的方法，利用一系列政府机构收集的行政数据。【原文：New Zealand will drop its five-yearly census and adopt a new approach using administrative data collected across a range of government agencies from 2030.】

item.title: 特朗普再次将 TikTok 出售期限延长 90 天
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）第三次延长了中国公司字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd.）剥离 TikTok 美国业务的最后期限，允许该社交媒体应用在谈判进行期间继续在美国运行。【原文：President Donald Trump is extending for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.】

item.title: KKR 和 GIC 是 MasOrange 和 Zegona 合资企业的最终竞标者之一
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.和新加坡政府投资公司（GIC Pte.【原文：KKR & Co. and GIC Pte. are among the final bidders for a stake in a fiber-optic broadband network venture owned by MasOrange and Zegona Communications Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 激进投资者向日本公司提出创纪录的建议
item.description: 激进投资者正在向日本公司提出数量空前的提案，这将使公司高管在年度股东大会上提心吊胆。【原文：Activist investors are inundating Japanese companies with an unprecedented number of proposals that will keep executives on their toes at annual general meetings.】

item.title: 米莱将阿根廷批发通胀降至 2020 年以来最低点
item.description: 周二，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）在经济方面再次取得胜利，因为数据显示 5 月份的批发价格出现了自大流行病最严重时期以来的首次下降，这为他在 10 月中期选举前的执政增添了动力。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei notched another economic victory Tuesday after data showed wholesale prices declined in May for the first time since the height of the pandemic, adding to his momentum before October midterm elections.】

item.title: 交易员纷纷押注下任美联储主席将下调美国利率
item.description: 美国利率交易员已经积累了创纪录的期货赌注，认为美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的任期将于 2026 年 5 月结束后，美联储将立即采取更加鸽派的倾向。【原文：US rates traders have amassed a record futures bet that the Federal Reserve will take on a more dovish tilt right after Chair Jerome Powell’s term ends in May 2026.】

item.title: Keyera 将以 38 亿美元收购 Plains 的加拿大 NGL 业务
item.description: Keyera Corp. 同意以 51.5 亿加元（37.7 亿美元）现金收购 Plains All American Pipeline LP 的加拿大天然气液化业务和部分美国资产。【原文：Keyera Corp. agreed to buy Plains All American Pipeline LP’s Canadian natural gas liquids business and some US assets for C$5.15 billion ($3.77 billion) in cash.】

item.title: 肯尼迪机场空中列车今夏票价下调 50%，吸引乘客放弃公路出行
item.description: 随着纽约市最繁忙机场的施工高峰期到来，穿梭于肯尼迪国际机场的旅客捷运公司将在今年夏天把票价降低 50%，以减少道路交通。【原文：The people mover that shuttles passengers to John F. Kennedy International Airport is cutting its fares by 50% this summer in a bid to reduce road traffic as construction peaks at the busiest New York City airport.】
